DOC.brief_summary: This study compare acute effect ingest banana ( BAN ) versus 6 % carbohydrate drink ( CHO ) 75-km cycle performance post-exercise inflammation , oxidative stress , innate immune function use traditional metabolomics-based profiling .
DOC.brief_title: Bananas Energy Source During Exercise : Metabolomics Approach
DOC.detailed_description: Trained cyclist ( N=14 ) complete two 75-km cycling time trial ( randomize , crossover ) ingest BAN CHO ( 0.2 g/kg carbohydrate every 15 min ) . Pre- , post- , 1-h-post-exercise blood sample analyze glucose , granulocyte ( GR ) monocyte ( MO ) phagocytosis ( PHAG ) oxidative burst activity , nine cytokine , F2-isoprostanes , ferric reduce ability plasma ( FRAP ) , metabolic profile use gas chromatography-mass spectrometry .
DOC.criteria: Male Ages 1845 year Cyclists , road race experience . Willing avoid use supplement , herb , medication study . Female Over age 45 year No cycle race experience Using supplement medication study
